title: What happens if our eyes’ refractive index becomes equal to the atmosphere’s refractive index? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thank you for asking Well its an hypothetical question so I can only give answer through physics So let us assume refractive index of our eye became 1 overnight. As we know an image of an object is formed on our retina only when light rays coming from a distant object intersect on our retina cell. Since light rays would be parallel to each other and would intersect at infinity, if not bended towards each other. Since human eyes have biconvex lenses which bend light rays inwards which then forms a real and inverted image on retina. But now refractivity of eye lens is equal to that of air so light rays cannot be bended towards each hence image won’t be formed. Only thing we can see is light of different colour superimposing each other. That’s what I would happen. P.S. If any conceptual mistake feel free to correct. Thank You.
